title: Worker Shortages, Pay Raises and Organizing Employees: What This Union Head Thinks About the Labor Market
sub_head: Sean O’Brien, who will take over as general president of the Teamsters in March, says workers have ‘an appetite for change’
body:
Sean O’Brien will soon take over as general president for the International Brotherhood of the Teamsters, one of the biggest unions in the U.S. with nearly 1.4 million members.
The 49-year-old Boston-area Teamster is gearing up for his new leadership role during a busy time in the labor movement. As the pandemic continues, many workers are leaving their jobs and employers are scrambling to fill positions during a nationwide labor shortage.
